discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/developer/data-platform/virtual-entities/get-started-ve#limitations-of-virtual-tables

B. No

Assigning record ownership to individual users doesn’t inherently facilitate data integration with virtual tables. To effectively implement virtual tables for data integration, you need to use a data provider or a service, like the OData v4 provider, to create and manage those virtual tables. Ownership management is a separate aspect that relates to security and access control, not the integration mechanism itself.

Only organization-owned tables are supported. The security filtering applied to user-owned tables is not supported. Access to the virtual table data can be turned on or off for individual users based on their security role. Field-level security is not supported.
